moves.1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Bb5 a6 4. Ba4: Morphy Defense, classical variation. All book so far.
moves.7. Bb3 d6 8. c3 O-O: Both men have now secured their King's position. Development and attack are now in order.
moves.9... h6: Anticipating White's next move, and taking action to limit the White QB's scope.
moves.10. d4: The long-prepared central thrust at last.
moves.10... Re8 11. Nbd2: The Q-side pieces bestir themselves at last.
moves.11... Bf8: Adding protection to the strong point at K4.
moves.12. d5: Locking the center and clarifying the game.
moves.12... Ne7: Black's play is on the K-side now, with White's lying on the other wing.
moves.13... bxc4: Cutting off the potential Pawn storm.
moves.14. Nxc4 c6: Trying to break up White's central wedge.
moves.15... Nxc6 16. Be3 Be6: Driving back the Knight. Draw agreed. White has an endgame advantage with a flank majority on the Q-side, but it would take a long time to try and exploit. Even if it could be exploited, it may not be enough to win.
